frameDefinitions: A speaker characterizes the intensity of an Attribute of an Entity by a Degree.
A Perpetrator intentionally sets fire to his own or someone else's property, often in order to collect an insurance payment on this property.
An Exerter, Action, or Force is capable of exerting or does exert a physical force at a level specified by the target.
A Weapon is an artifact created specifically to cause harm or damage.

This frame is concerned with the idea that people (Participant_1, Participant_2, or Participants) participate in an organized, rule-governed activity (the Competition) in order to achieve some advantageous outcome (often the Prize).
A Resisting_entity is capable of resisting or does resist a physical Opposing_force to a level specified by the target.
frameExamples: Eugenie loved the sea and was a <t>strong</t> swimmer.
Did you, or did you not, fire this  <fex name='Weapon'><t>gun</t></fex> with intent to harm my client?
The great and <t>impregnable</t> fortress still stands today.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Entity</fen> for which a particular gradable <fen>Attribute</fen> is appropriate and under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the intensity of the <fen>Attribute</fen> from the norm or from the value for another <fen>Entity</fen>. This role is incorporated for each LU in this frame.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Value</fen> for the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> is has the <fen>Attribute</fen> to a given <fen>Degree</fen>.
The illegal setting of fire to destroy something.
The <fen>Perpetrator</fen> sets fire to a building in order to gain some benefit from so doing.
<fen>Victim</fen> identifies the enity that is negatively effected by the arson.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the arson occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the arson occurs.
The <fen>Exerter</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Force</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Action</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
The location where the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
An entity prototypically used by a <fen>Wielder</fen> to cause damage.
This role identifies the first (or only) participant in a competition.
This role identifies the second participant in a competition.
This role is used for plural NP participants in a competition.
This role is used for the name of the competition.
The period of time when the <fen>Competition</fen> occurs.

Where the event takes place. 
A constituent tagged as <fen>Place</fen> may require annotation on a secondary FE-layer.
The <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> is the item that resists the <fen>Opposing_force</fen> to the level specified by the target.

The <fen>Opposing_force</fen> is the item placed in opposition to the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen>. <fen>Opposing_force</fen> hinders, blocks, helps, or allows (lets) the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> to resist at the level specified by the target. Sometimes this Core role is incorporated in the target; otherwise, it is often null instantiated in example sentences.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
The location where the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The two men</fex> were charged with arson when found running from the burning factory.
There has been an increase in the number of  arson attacks <fex>on local schools</fex>.
Salesmen touted the power <fex>of the engine's motor</fex>.
No one should underestimate the mighty <fex>strength</fex> of the dung beetle.
She gave him a playful, weak <fex>punch</fex> in the arm.
My quads feel particularly weak <fex>after 100 squats</fex>.
Muhammad Ali's force <fex>in the ring</fex> was indisputable.
They used to shoot these long-range <fex><t>rifles</t></fex> with scopes and hit targets a mile away.
First layer: John's first competition <fex>at Wimbledon</fex> astonished the crowd.
These are made from a tough <fex>plastic foam</fex> and are very light to wear.
The fortress was impregnable <fex>to attack by hostile invaders</fex>.
The retaining wall was even weaker <fex>yesterday</fex>, and had begun to crumble.
They decided the tree-house would be sturdiest <fex>in the big old backyard oak</fex>.
